100.name: Tentacus
100.text: Your opponent must pay you 1[AE] in order to use an artifact.

101.name: The Terror
101.text: Play: If your opponent has no [AE], gain 2 [AE].

102.name: Tocsin
102.text: Reap: Your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

103.name: Tolas
103.text: Each time a creature is destroyed, its opponent gains 1[AE].

104.name: Truebaru
104.text:
You must lose 3[AE] in order to play Truebaru.
Destroyed: Gain 5[AE].

106.name: Flame-Wreathed
106.text: This creature gets +2 power and gains hazardous 2.

107.name: Bouncing Deathquark
107.text: Play: Destroy an enemy creature and a friendly creature. You may repeat this effect as many times as you like, as long as it is possible to repeat the entire effect.

108.name: Dimension Door
108.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, any [AE] you would gain from reaping is stolen from your opponent instead.

109.name: Effervescent Principle
109.text: Play: Each player loses half their [AE] (rounding down the loss). Gain 1 chain.

110.name: Foggify
110.text: Play: Your opponent cannot use creatures to fight on their next turn.

111.name: Help from Future Self
111.text: Play: Search your deck and discard pile for a Timetraveller, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your discard pile into your deck.

112.name: Interdimensional Graft
112.text: Play: If an opponent forges a key on their next turn, they must give you their remaining [AE].

113.name: Knowledge is Power
113.text: Play: Choose One. Archive a card, or, for each archived card you have, gain 1[AE].

115.name: Library Access
115.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each time you play another card, draw a card.

116.name: Neuro Syphon
116.text: Play: If your opponent has more [AE] than you, steal 1[AE] and draw a card.

117.name: Phase Shift
117.text: Play: You may play one non-Logos card this turn.

118.name: Positron Bolt
118.text: Play: Deal 3[D] to a flank creature. Deal 2[D] to its neighbor. Deal 1[D] to the second creature's other neighbor.

119.name: Random Access Archives
119.text: Play: Archive the top card of your deck.

120.name: Remote Access
120.text: Play: Use an opponent's artifact as if it were yours.

121.name: Reverse Time
121.text: Play: Swap your deck and your discard pile. Then, shuffle your deck.

122.name: Scrambler Storm
122.text: Play: Your opponent cannot play actions on their next turn.

123.name: Sloppy Labwork
123.text: Play: Archive a card. Discard a card.

124.name: Twin Bolt Emission
124.text: Play: Deal 2[D] to a creature, and deal 2[D] to a different creature.

125.name: Wild Wormhole
125.text: Play: Play the top card of your deck.

127.name: Chaos Portal
127.text: Action: Choose a house. Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is of that house, play it.

128.name: Crazy Killing Machine
128.text: Action: Discard the top card of each player's deck. For each of those cards, destroy a creature or artifact of that card's house, if able. If 2 cards are not destroyed as a result of this, destroy Crazy Killing Machine.

130.name: Mobius Scroll
130.text: Action: Archive Mobius Scroll and up to 2 cards from your hand.

131.name: Pocket Universe
131.text:
You may spend [AE] on Pocket Universe when forging keys.
Action: Move 1[AE] from your pool to Pocket Universe.

132.name: Spangler Box
132.text: Action: Purge a creature in play. If you do, your opponent gains control of Spangler Box. If Spangler Box leaves play, return to play all cards purged by Spangler Box.

133.name: Spectral Tunneler
133.text: Action: Choose a creature. For the remainder of the turn, that creature is considered a flank creature and gains, "Reap: Draw a card."

134.name: Strange Gizmo
134.text: After you forge a key, destroy each creature and artifact.

135.name: The Howling Pit
135.text: During their "draw cards" step, each player refills their and to 1 additional card.

137.name: Brain Eater
137.text: After a creature is destroyed fighting Brain Eater, draw a card.

138.name: Dextre
138.text:
Play: Capture 1 [AE].
Destroyed: Put Dextre on top of your deck.

140.name: Dr Escotera
140.text: Play: Gain 1[AE] for each forged key your opponent has.

141.name: Dysania
141.text: Play: Your opponent discards each of their archived cards. You gain 1[AE] for each card discarded this way.

143.name: Harland Mindlock
143.text: Play: Take control of an enemy flank creature until Harland Mindlock leaves play.

145.name: Mother
145.text: During the "draw cards" step, refill your hand to 1 additional card.

146.name: Neutron Shark
146.text: Play/Fight/Reap: Destroy an enemy creature or artifact and a friendly creature or artifact. Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is not a Logos card, trigger this effect again.

147.name: Novu Archaeologist
147.text: Action: Archive a card from your discard pile.

148.name: Ozmo, Martianologist
148.text: Fight/Reap: Heal 3 damage from a Mars creature or stun a Mars creature.

149.name: Psychic Bug
149.text: Play/Reap: Look at your opponent's hand.

150.name: Replicator
150.text: Reap: Trigger the Reap effect of another creature in play as if you controlled that creature. (That creature does not exhaust.)

151.name: Research Smoko
151.text: Destroyed: Archive the top card of your deck.

152.name: Skippy Timehog
152.text: Play: Your opponent cannot use any cards next turn.

153.name: Timetraveller
153.text:
Play: Draw 2 cards.
Action: Shuffle Timetraveller into your deck.

154.name: Titan Mechanic
154.text: While Titan Mechanic is on a flank, each key costs -1[AE].

155.name: Vespilion Theorist
155.text: Reap: Choose a house. Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is of that house, archive it and gain 1[AE]. Otherwise, discard it.

156.name: Veylan Analyst
156.text: Each time you use an artifact, gain 1[AE].

157.name: Experimental Therapy
157.text: This creature belongs to all houses. Play: Stun and exhaust this creature.

158.name: Rocket Boots
158.text: This creature gains, "Fight/Reap: If this is the first time this creature was used this turn, ready it."

159.name: Transposition Sandals
159.text: This creature gains, "Action: Swap this creature with another friendly creature in the battleline. You may use that other creature this turn."

161.name: Battle Fleet
161.text: Play: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. For each card revealed this way, draw 1 card.

162.name: Deep Probe
162.text: Play: Choose a house. Reveal your opponent's hand. Discard each creature of that house revealed this way.

163.name: EMP Blast
163.text: Play: Each Mars creature and each Robot creature is stunned. Each artifact is destroyed.

164.name: Hypnotic Command
164.text: Play: For each friendly Mars creature, choose an enemy creature to capture 1[AE] from their own side.

165.name: Irradiated Aember
165.text: Play: If your opponent has 6[AE] or more, deal 3[D] to each enemy creature.

166.name: Key Abduction
166.text: Play: Return each Mars creature to its owner's hand. Then, you may forge a key at +9[AE] current cost, reduced by 1[AE] for each card in your hand.

167.name: Martian Hounds
167.text: Play: Choose a creature. For each damaged creature, give the chosen creature two +1 power counters.

168.name: Martians Make Bad Allies
168.text: Play: Reveal your hand. Purge each revealed non-Mars creature and gain 1[AE] for each card purged this way.

169.name: Mass Abduction
169.text: Play: Put up to 3 damaged enemy creatures into your archives. If any of these creatures leave your archives, they are put into their owner's hand instead.

170.name: Mating Season
170.text: Play: Shuffle each Mars creature into its owner's deck. Each player gains 1[AE] for each creature shuffled into their deck this way.

171.name: Mothership Support
171.text: Play: For each friendly ready Mars creature, deal 2[D] to a creature. (You may choose a different creature each time.)

172.name: Orbital Bombardment
172.text: Play: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. For each card revealed this way deal 2[D] to a creature. (You may choose a different creature each time.)

173.name: Phosphorus Stars
173.text: Play: Stun each non-Mars creature. Gain 2 chains.

174.name: Psychic Network
174.text: Play: Steal 1[AE] for each friendly ready Mars creature.

175.name: Sample Collection
175.text: Play: Put an enemy creature into your archives for each key your opponent has forged. If any of these creatures leave your archives, they are put into their owner's hand instead.

176.name: Shatter Storm
176.text: Play: Lose all your [AE]. Then, your opponent loses triple the amount of [AE] you lost this way.

177.name: Soft Landing
177.text: Play: The next creature or artifact you play this turn enters play ready.

178.name: Squawker
178.text: Play: Ready a Mars creature or stun a non-Mars creature.

179.name: Total Recall
179.text: Play: For each friendly ready creature, gain 1[AE]. Return each friendly creature to your hand.

180.name: Combat Pheromones
180.text: Omni: Sacrifice Combat Pheromones. You may use up to 2 other Mars cards this turn.

181.name: Commpod
181.text: Action: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. For each card revealed this way, you may ready one creature.

182.name: Crystal Hive
182.text: Action: For the rest of the turn gain 1[AE] when you reap.

183.name: Custom Virus
183.text: Omni: Sacrifice Custom Virus. Purge a creature from your hand. Destroy each creature that shares a trait with the purged creature.

184.name: Feeding Pit
184.text: Action: Discard a creature from your hand. If you do, gain 1[AE].

185.name: Invasion Portal
185.text: Action: Discard cards from the top of your deck until you discard a Mars creature or run out of cards. If you discard a Mars creature this way, put it into your hand.

186.name: Incubation Chamber
186.text: Omni: Reveal a Mars creature from your hand. If you do, archive it.

187.name: Mother Gun
187.text: Action: Reveal any number of Mars cards from your hand. Deal damage to a creature equal to the number of cards revealed this way.

188.name: Sniffer
188.text: Action: For the remainder of the turn, each creature loses elusive.

189.name: Swap Widget
189.text: Action: Return a friendly mars creature to your hand. If you do, put a Mars creature with a different name from your hand into play, then ready it.

190.name: Blypyp
190.text: Reap: The next Mars creature you play this turn enters play ready.

191.name: Chuff Ape
191.text: Chuff Ape enters play stunned. Fight/Reap: You may sacrifice another creature. If you do, fully heal Chuff Ape.

192.name: Ether Spider
192.text:
Ether Spider deals no damage when fighting.
Each [AE] that would be added to your opponent's pool is captured by Ether Spider instead.

193.name: Grabber Jammer
193.text:
Your opponent's keys cost +1[AE].
Fight/Reap: Capture 1[AE].

194.name: Grommid
194.text:
You cannot play creatures.
After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Grommid, your opponent loses 1[AE].

195.name: "John Smyth"
195.text: Fight/Reap: Ready a non-Agent Mars creature.

196.name: Mindwarper
196.text: Action: Choose an enemy creature. It captures 1[AE] from its own side.

197.name: Phylyx the Disintegrator
197.text: Action: Your opponent loses 1[AE] for each other friendly Mars creature.

198.name: Qyxxlyx Plauge Master
198.text: Fight/Reap: Deal 3[D] to each Human creature. This damage cannot be prevented by armor.

199.text: After you play another Mars creature, fully heal Tunk.

200.name: Uliq Megamouth
200.text: Fight/Reap: Use a friendly non-Mars creature.

201.text: Reap: Put an enemy creature into your archives. If that creature leaves your archives, it is put into its owner's hand instead.

202.text: Reap: You may archive a friendly creature or artifact from play.

Yxili Marauder gets +1 power for each [AE] on it.
Play: Capture 1[AE] for each ready Mars creature.

204.text: Fight/Reap: Deal 2[D] to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, purge it.

206.name: Zorg
206.text:
Zorg enters play stunned.
Before Fight: Stun the creature Zorg fights and each of that creature's neighbors.

207.text: Fight/Reap: You may reveal a creature from your hand. If you do, archive it, and Zyzzix the Many gets 3 power tokens.

208.text: This creature gains, "Destroyed: You may put this creature into its owner's archives."

210.name: Jammer Pack
210.text: This creature gains, "Your opponent's keys cost +2[AE].

211.text: This creature gains, "Reap: Choose a creature. Deal 1[D] to that creature for each Mars creature in play."

212.text: Play: Choose one: Destroy each Dis creature, or gain 1[AE].

213.text: Play: Choose a house. Stun each creature of that house.

214.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each creature you play gains, "Play: Deal 2[D] to an enemy creature."

215.text: Play: Heal 1 damage from each creature. Gain 1[AE] for each creature healed in this way.

217.name: Doorstep to Heaven
217.text: Play: Each player with 6[AE] or more is reduced to 5[AE].

218.name: Glorious Few
218.text: Play: For each creature your opponent controls in excess of you, gain 1[AE].

220.text: Play: Ready and use a friendly creature.

221.name: Mighty Lance
221.text: Play: Deal 3[D] to a creature and 3[D] to a neighbor of that creature.

222.text: Play: Destroy each of your artifacts. Gain 2[AE] for each artifact destroyed this way.

223.text: Play: Ready and fight with a friendly creature 3 times, each time against a different enemy creature. Resolve these fights one at a time.

224.name: Radiant Truth
224.text: Play: Stun each enemy creature not on a flank.

225.name: Shield of Justice
225.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature cannot be dealt damage.

226.name: Take Hostages
226.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each time a friendly creature fights, it captures 1[AE].

227.name: Terms of Redress
227.text: Play: Choose a friendly creature to capture 2[AE].

228.name: The Harder They Come
228.text: Play: Purge a creature with power 5 or higher.

229.name: The Spirit's Way
229.text: Play: Destroy each creature with power 3 or higher.

231.name: Epic Quest
231.text:
Play: Archive each friendly Knight creature in play.
Omni: If you have played 7 or more Sanctum cards this turn, sacrifice Epic Quest and forge a key at no cost.

232.name: Gorm of Omm
232.text: Omni: Sacrifice Gorm of Omm. Destroy an artifact.

233.name: Hallowed Blaster
233.text: Action: Heal 3 damage from a creature.

234.name: Potion of Invulnerability
234.text: Omni: Sacrifice Potion of Invulnerability. For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature cannot be dealt damage.

235.name: Round Table
235.text: Each friendly Knight creature gets +1 power and gains taunt.

236.name: Sigil of Brotherhood
236.text: Omni: Sacrifice Sigil of Brotherhood. For the remainder of the turn, you may use Sanctum creatures.

237.name: Whispering Reliquary
237.text: Action: Return an artifact to its owner's hand.

238.name: Bulwark
238.text: Each of Bulwark's neighbors gains +2 Armor.

241.name: Commander Remiel
241.text: Reap: Use a friendly non-Sanctum creature.

242.name: Duma the Martyr
242.text: Destroyed: Fully heal each other friendly creature and draw 2 cards.

243.name: Francus
243.text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Francus, Francus captures 1[AE].

244.name: Grey Monk
244.text:
Each friendly creature gets +1 armor.
Reap: Heal 2 damage from a creature.

245.name: Hayyel the Merchant
245.text: Each time you play an artifact, gain 1[AE].

246.name: Horseman of Death
246.text: Play: Return each Horseman from your discard pile to your hand.

249.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature can be used as if they were in the active house, but can only fight.

250.name: Jehu the Bureaucrat

251.name: Lady Maxena
251.text:
Play: Stun a creature.
Action: Return Lady Maxena to her owner's hand.

252.text: Before Fight: Deal 3[D] to each neighbor of the creature Lord Golgotha fights.

253.text: Play: Destroy an enemy creature. Repeat this cards effect if your opponent still controls more creatures than you.

256.name: Sanctum Guardian
256.text: Fight/Reap: Swap Sanctum Guardian with another friendly creature in your battleline.

258.name: Sergeant Zakiel
258.text: Play: You may ready and fight with a neighboring creature.

259.name: Staunch Knight

260.text: Play: If your opponent has 7 or more [AE], capture all but 5 of it.

262.text: Play: Destroy each creature with Elusive.

263.text: This creature gains hazardous 2 and, "Destroyed: Fully heal this creature and destroy Armageddon Cloak instead."

264.name: Mantle of the Zealot
264.text: This creature gains, "You may use this creature as if it belonged to the active house."

265.name: Protect the Weak
265.text: This creature gains +1 Armor and gains Taunt.

266.name: Shoulder Armor
266.text: While this creature is on a flank, it gets +2 armor and +2 power.

267.text: Play: If your opponent has more [AE] than you, steal 1[AE]. Repeat this card's effect if your opponent still has more [AE] than you.

268.text: Play: Deal 4[D] to a creature that is not on a flank with 2[D] splash.

269.name: Finishing Blow
269.text: Play: Destroy a damaged creature. If you do, steal 1[AE].

270.name: Ghostly Hand
270.text: Play: If your opponent has exactly 1[AE], steal it.

272.text: Play: Look at your opponent's hand. You may choose and purge a Sanctum card in it.

273.text: Play: Forge a key at +6[AE] current cost. If your opponent has no [AE], forge a key at +2[AE] current cost instead.

274.name: Lights Out
274.text: Play: Return 2 enemy creatures to their owner's hand.

275.name: Miasma
275.text: Play: You opponent skips the "forge a key" step on their next turn.

276.name: Nerve Blast
276.text: Play: Steal 1[AE]. If you do, deal 2[D] to a creature.

277.name: One Last Job
277.text: Play: Purge each friendly Shadows creature. Steal 1[AE] for each creature purged this way.

278.name: Oubliette
278.text: Play: Purge a creature with power 3 or lower.

279.text: Play: Sacrifice a friendly creature. If you do, deal 3[D] each to 2 creatures.

281.text: Play: Deal 2[D] to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, steal 1[AE].

282.name: Routine Job
282.text: Play: Steal 1[AE]. Then, steal 1[AE] for each copy of Routine Job in your discard pile.

283.name: Too Much to Protect
283.text: Play: Steal all but 6 of your opponent's [AE].

284.name: Treasure Map
284.text: Play: If you have not played any cards this turn, gain 3[AE]. For the remainder of this turn, you cannot play cards.

285.name: Customs Office
285.text: Your opponent must pay you 1[AE] in order to play an artifact.

286.name: Evasion Sigil
286.text: Before a creature fights, discard the top card of its controller's deck. If the discarded card is of the active house, exhaust that creature with no effect.

287.name: Longfused Mines
287.text: Omni: Sacrifice Longfused Mines. Deal 3[D] to each enemy creature not on a flank.

288.name: Masterplan
288.text:
Play: Put a card from your hand facedown beneath Masterplan.
Omni: Play the card beneath Masterplan. Sacrifice Masterplan.

289.name: Safe Place
289.text:
You may spend [AE] on Safe Place when forging keys.
Action: Move 1[AE] from your pool to Safe Place.

290.name: Seeker Needle
290.text: Action: Deal 1[D] to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, gain 1[AE].

292.name: Special Delivery
292.text: Omni: Sacrifice Special Delivery. Deal 3[D] to a flank creature. If this damage destroys that creature, purge it.

293.name: Speed Sigil
293.text: The first creature played each turn enters play ready.

294.name: Subtle Maul
294.text: Action: Your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

295.name: The Sting
295.text:
Skip your "forge a key" step.
You get all [AE] spent by your opponent when forging keys.
Action: Sacrifice The Sting.

296.name: Bad Penny
296.text: Destroyed: Return Bad Penny to your hand.

298.name: Carlo Phantom
298.text: Each time you play an artifact, steal 1[AE].

299.name: Deipno Spymaster
299.text: Omni: Choose a friendly creature. You may use that creature this turn.

300.name: Faygin
300.text: Reap: Return an Urchin from play or from your discard pile to your hand.

302.name: Mack the Knife
302.text:
You may use Mack the Knife as if it belonged to the active house.
Action: Deal 1[D] to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, gain 1[AE].

305.name: Nexus
305.text: Reap: Use an opponent's artifact as if it were yours.

309.name: Selwyn the Fence
309.text: Fight/Reap: Move 1[AE] from one of your cards to your pool.

310.name: Shadow Self
310.text: Shadow Self deals no damage when fighting. Damage dealt to non-Specter neighbors is dealt to Shadow Self instead.

312.text: Reap: If you forged a key this turn, take control of an enemy flank creature.

313.name: Sneklifter
313.text: Play: Take control of an enemy artifact. While under your control, if it does not belong to one of your three houses, it is considered to be of house Shadows.

317.name: Ring of Invisibility
317.text: This creature gains elusive and skirmish.

318.name: Silent Dagger
318.text: This creature gains, "Reap: Deal 4[D] to a flank creature."

319.name: Cooperative Hunting
319.text: Play: Deal 1[D] for each friendly creature in play. You may divide this damage among any number of creatures.

322.name: Fogbank
322.text: Play: Your opponent cannot use creatures to fight on their next turn.

323.name: Full Moon
323.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1[AE] each time you play a creature.

324.name: Grasping Vines
324.text: Play: Return up to 3 artifacts to their owners' hand.

325.name: Key Charge
325.text: Play: Lose 1[AE]. If you do, you may forge a key at current cost.

326.name: Lifeweb
326.text: Play: If your opponent played 3 or more creatures on their previous turn, steal 2[AE].

327.name: Lost in the Woods
327.text: Play: Choose 2 friendly and 2 enemy creatures. Shuffle each chosen creature into its owner's deck.

328.name: Mimicry
328.text: When you play this card, treat it as a copy of an action card in your opponent's discard pile.

329.name: Nature's Call
329.text: Play: Return up to 3 creatures to their owners' hands.

332.name: Regrowth
332.text: Play: Return a creature from your discard pile to your hand.

333.name: Save the Pack
333.text: Play: Destroy each damaged creature. Gain 1 chain.

334.name: Scout
334.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, up to 2 friendly creatures gain skirmish. Then, fight with those creatures one at a time.

335.name: Stampede
335.text: Play: If you used 3 or more creatures this turn, steal 2[AE].

336.name: The Common Cold
336.text: Play: Deal 1[D] to each creature. You may destroy all Mars creatures.

337.name: Troop Call
337.text: Play: Return each friendly Niffle creature from your discard pile and from play to your hand.

338.name: Vigor

339.text: Play: Deal 1[D] to each enemy creature for each [AE] on it. Return all [AE] on those creatures to your pool.

342.text: Action: If your opponent has 6[AE] or more, steal 1[AE].

346.name: Bigtwig

Bigtwig can only fight stunned creatures.

347.text: During each turn in which Untamed is not your active house, you may play one untamed card.

349.name: Chota Hazri
349.text: Play: Lose 1[AE]. If you do, you may forge a key at current cost.

You cannot use this card unless you have discarded an Untamed card from your hand this turn.

359.text: Play: Deal 2[D] to an enemy creature.

365.name: Piranha Monkeys
365.text: Play/Reap: Deal 2[D] to each other creature.

366.name: Teliga
366.text: Each time your opponent plays a creature, gain 1[AE].

367.name: Hunting Witch
367.text: Each time you play another creature, gain 1[AE].

368.name: Witch of the Eye
368.text: Reap: Return a card from your discard pile to your hand.

001.name: Anger
001.text: Play: Ready and fight with a friendly creature.

002.name: Barehanded
002.text: Play: Put each artifact on top of it's owners deck.

003.name: Blood Money
003.text: Play: Place 2[AE] from the common supply on an enemy creature.

004.name: Brothers in Battle
004.text: Play: Choose a house. For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature of that house may fight.

005.name: Burn the Stockpile
005.text: Play: If your opponent has 7[AE] or more, they lose 4[AE].

006.name: Champion's Challenge
006.text: Play: Destroy each enemy creature except the most powerful enemy creature. Destroy each friendly creature except the most powerful friendly creature. Ready and fight with your remaining creature.

007.name: Coward's End
007.text: Play: Destroy each undamaged creature. Gain 3 chains.

008.name: Follow the Leader
008.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature may fight.

009.name: Lava Ball
009.text: Play: Deal 4[D] to a creature with 2[D] splash.

010.name: Loot the Bodies
010.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1[AE] each time an enemy creature is destroyed.

011.name: Take that, Smartypants
011.text: Play: Steal 2[AE] if your opponent has 3 or more Logos cards in play.

013.name: Relentless Assault
013.text: Play: Ready and fight with up to 3 different friendly creatures, one at a time.

014.name: Smith
014.text: Play: Gain 2[AE] if you control more creatures than your opponent.

015.name: Sound the Horns
015.text: Play: Discard cards from the top of your deck until you either discard a Brobnar creature or run out of cards. If you discarded a Brobnar creature this way, put it into your hand.

016.name: Tremor
016.text: Play: Stun a creature and each of its neighbors.

017.name: Unguarded Camp
017.text: Play: For each creature you have in excess of your opponent, a friendly creature captures 1[AE]. Each creature cannot capture more than 1[AE] this way.

018.name: Warsong
018.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1[AE] every time a friendly creature fights.

019.name: Autocannon
019.text: Deal 1[D] to each creature after it enters play.

022.name: Gauntlet of Command
022.text: Action: Ready and fight with a friendly creature.

023.name: Iron Obelisk
023.text: Your opponentâ€™s keys cost +1[AE] for each friendly damaged Brobnar creature.

024.name: Mighty Javelin
024.text: Omni: Sacrifice Mighty Javelin. Deal 4[D] to a creature.

025.name: Pile of Skulls
025.text: Each time an enemy creature is destroyed during your turn, a friendly creature captures 1[AE].

026.name: Screechbomb
026.text: Omni: Sacrifice Screechbomb. Your opponent loses 2[AE].

027.name: The Warchest
027.text: Action: Gain 1[AE] for each enemy creature that was destroyed in a fight this turn.

028.name: Bilgum Avalanche
028.text: After you forge a key, deal 2[D] to each enemy creature.

029.name: Valdr
029.text: Valdr deals +2[D] while attacking an enemy creature on the flank.

031.name: Earthshaker
031.text: Play: Destroy each creature with power 3 or lower.

032.name: Firespitter
032.text: Before Fight: Deal 1[D] to each enemy creature.

033.name: Ganger Chieftain
033.text: Play: You may ready and fight with a neighboring creature.

036.name: Hebe the Huge
036.text: Play: Deal 2[D] to each other undamaged creature.

037.name: Kelifi Dragon
037.text:
Kefili Dragon cannot be played unless you have 7 or more [AE].
Fight/Reap: Gain 1[AE]. Deal 5[D] to a creature.

038.name: King of the Crag
038.text: Each enemy Brobnar creature gets -2 power.

039.name: Krump
039.text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Krump, its controller loses 1[AE].

040.name: Lomir Flamefist
040.text: Play: If your opponent has 7[AE] or more, they lose 2[AE].

041.name: Looter Goblin
041.text: Reap: For the remainder of the turn, gain 1[AE] each time an enemy creature is destroyed.

042.name: Mugwump
042.text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Mugwump, fully heal Mugwump and give it a +1 power counter.

043.name: Pingle Who Annoys
043.text: Deal 1[D] to each enemy creature after it enters play.

044.name: Rock-Hurling Giant
044.text:
During your turn, each time you discard a Brobnar card from your hand, you may deal 4[D]
a creature.

045.name: Rogue Ogre
045.text: At the end of your turn, if you played exactly one card this turn, Rogue Ogre heals 2 damage and captures 1.

047.name: Tireless Crocag
047.text:
Tireless Crocag can not reap.
You may use Tireless Crocag as if it belonged to the active house.
If your opponent has no creatures in play, destroy Tireless Crocag.

049.name: Wardrummer
049.text: Play: Return each other friendly Brobnar creature to your hand.

051.name: Phoenix Heart
051.text: This creature gains, "Destroyed: Return this creature to its owner's hand and deal 3[D] to each creature in play.

052.name: Yo Mama Mastery
052.text:
This creature gains Taunt.
Play: Fully heal this creature.

053.name: A Fair Game
053.text: Play: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck and reveal their hand. You gain 1[AE] for each card of the discarded card's house revealed in this way. Your opponent repeats the preceding effect on you.

054.name: Arise!
054.text: Play: Choose a house. Return each creature of that house from your discard pile to your hand. Gain 1 chain.

055.name: Control the Weak
055.text: Play: Choose a house on your opponent's identity card. Your opponent must choose that house as their active house next turn.

056.name: Creeping Oblivion
056.text: Play: Purge up to 2 cards from a discard pile.

057.name: Dance of Doom
057.text: Play: Choose a number. Destroy each creature with power equal to that number.

058.name: Fear
058.text: Play: Return an enemy creature to its owner's hand.

059.name: Gateway to Dis
059.text: Play: Destroy each creature. Gain 3 chains.

060.name: Gongoozle
060.text: Play: Deal 3[D] to a creature. If it is not destroyed, its owner discards a card from their hand.

061.name: Guilty Hearts
061.text: Play: Destroy each creature with any [AE] on it.

062.name: Hand of Dis
062.text: Play: Destroy a creature that is not on a flank.

063.name: Hecatomb
063.text: Play: Destroy each Dis creature. Each player gains 1[AE] for each creature they controlled that was destroyed this way.

064.name: Tendrils of Pain
064.text: Play: Deal 1[D] to each creature. Deal an additional 3[D] to each creature if your opponent forged a key on their previous turn.

065.name: Hysteria
065.text: Play: Return each creature to its owner's hand.

066.name: Key Hammer
066.text: Play: If your opponent forged a key on their previous turn, unforge it. Your opponent gains 6[AE].

067.name: Mind Barb
067.text: Play: Your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

068.name: Pandemonium
068.text: Play: Each undamaged creature captures 1[AE] from its opponent.

069.name: Poltergeist
069.text: Play: Use an artifact controlled by any player as if it were yours. Destroy that artifact.

070.name: Red-Hot Armor
070.text: Play: Each enemy creature with armor loses all of its armor until the end of the turn and is dealt 1[D] for each point of armor it lost this way.

071.name: Three Fates
071.text: Play: Destroy the 3 most powerful creatures.

072.name: Annihilation Ritual
072.text: When a creature would enter a discard pile from play, it is purged instead.

074.name: Key to Dis
074.text: Omni: Sacrifice Key to Dis. Destroy each creature.

075.name: Lash of Broken Dreams
075.text: Action: Keys cost +3[AE] during your opponent's next turn.

077.name: Lifeward
077.text: Omni: Sacrifice Lifeward. Your opponent cannot play creatures on their next turn.

078.name: Sacrificial Altar
078.text: Action: Purge a friendly Human creature from play. If you do, play a creature from your discard pile.

079.name: Screaming Cave
079.text: Action: Shuffle your hand and discard pile into your deck.

080.name: Soul Snatcher
080.text: Each time a creature is destroyed, its owner gains 1[AE].

082.name: Drumble
082.text: Play: If your opponent has 7A or more, capture all of it.

084.name: Eater of the Dead
084.text: Fight/Reap: Purge a creature from a discard pile. If you do, put a +1 power counter on Eater of the Dead.

085.name: Ember Imp
085.text: Your opponent cannot play more than 2 cards each turn.

086.name: Gabos Longarms
086.text: Before Fight: Choose a creature. Gabos Longarms deals damage to that creature rather than the one it is fighting.

087.name: Overlord Greking
087.text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Overlord Greking, put that creature into play under your control.

088.name: Guardian Demon
088.text: Play/Fight/Reap: Heal up to 2 damage from a creature. Deal that amount of damage to another creature.

089.name: Master of 1
089.text: Reap: You may destroy a creature with 1 power.

090.name: Master of 2
090.text: Reap: You may destroy a creature with 2 power.

091.name: Master of 3
091.text: Reap: You may destroy a creature with 3 power.

093.name: Pitlord
093.text: While Pitlord is in play, you must choose Dis as your active house.

094.name: Restringuntus
094.text: Play: Choose a house. Your opponent cannot choose that house as their active house until Restringuntus leaves play.

095.name: Shaffles
095.text: At the end of your turn, your opponent loses 1[AE].

096.name: Shooler
096.text: Play: If your opponent has 4[AE] or more, steal 1[AE].

097.name: Snudge
097.text: Fight/Reap: Return an artifact or flank creature to its owner's hand.

098.name: Stealer of Souls
098.text: After an enemy creature is destroyed while fighting Stealer of Souls, purge that creature and gain 1[AE].

099.name: Succubus
099.text: During their "draw cards" step, your opponent refills their hand to 1 less card.
